page.title: 12Religion in Maesbrook
page.content: St.John's Church. This was built in memory of Richard Jones Croxon by his sisters Frances,Alice and Elizabeth in 1878. The vicar at the present time is the Rev.Hodson. The church has a single bell and a very interesting font,made of a hard grey stone with beautiful carvings on the sides.The lid is made of oak with wrought iron decorations.Inside the church are many plaques such as : "In loving memory of a husband, William Greaves Walker who,for 19 years,was the rector of Knockin and he died on April 26th 1917.Also in memory of his son Edward William Walker who fell on active service in Palestine on November 6th 1917."
